website_summaries.verdict: Grain-free formula. Some owners report their puppies eat this food better than they eat treats because of great taste.
pros: Customers report their puppies love the taste of this food
Formula helps puppies maintain a healthy coat that owners say looks great
cons: Customers say this food will grow mold if stored too long
Higher price point than some other puppy food options

customer_reviews.title: FDA WARNING
customer_reviews.text: Just one of the dry foods mentioned as a possible cause of heart disorder today. Now I have to find another for my elderly poodle cross. So disappointed in the industry! So many warnings. You can rescue, but what will you feed????
customer_reviews.author: GingerPeachy

customer_reviews.title: Finally a food my lab will eat
customer_reviews.text: I was having a terrible time finding a quality food that my lab would actually eat! This was recommended to me and my dog really likes it. Great!.....THEN.....out comes all the news about the dangers of "grain free"....I contacted the company and they quickly responded that they already supplement the food with the needed taurine that other foods lack. So... dog likes it and good customer service, what more could I ask?
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: my dogs will not touch it
customer_reviews.text: i have some mutts not fancy dogs they eat almost anything none of them would eat this stuff one or two bites that's it I left it out for them all day the bowls were still full. so I put some dog chow out there they tore it up. there has to be something very bad with this food for them to not eat it
customer_reviews.author: Avenger

customer_reviews.title: ... ordered this food two times and my puppy absolutely loved it. The last time I ordered I opened ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this food two times and my puppy absolutely loved it. The last time I ordered I opened the bag and could instantly tell it was not the same as the past. Not sure if maybe it was made in a different plant but my dog wont touch it. My dog will eat pretty much anything... but not this food. That concerns me, I wont be ordering again, switching to Orijen
customer_reviews.author: jason o.

customer_reviews.title: “No more gas” for a very picky eater.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Adult at the same time I purchased the puppy of the same flavor combination (Bison & Venison). My very picky eater, Sarah (Yorkie) liked this but she liked the puppy even more. The puppy’s kibble are smaller and she likes the taste of the puppy a little more. I had to switch from Royal Canin because it gave her bad gas. I would certainly buy this again because she will certainly eat it and that’s surprising given the fact that she’s very picky and NO GAS with this brand. Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: FDA study- Taste of the Wild causes heart disease
customer_reviews.text: The FDA links all taste of the wild brands with heart disease in dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Hollis Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe all the bad press
customer_reviews.text: Someone has put a smear campaign out against TOTW. I just looked and it is rated one of the top five dry dog foods by the Dog Food Advisor. My dogs have been eating it their whole life. They are healthy. My breeder highly recommended it, and all her mini aussies and daschsunds eat it, and have been raised on it. I have nothing to gain by this review. I just think its a bunch of bull that is being put out about TOTW.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't feed my ACD's anything else.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food for my dogs. I did extensive research on what would be the best food for my two Australian cattle dogs. This is perfect for them. There are no grains, which for my dogs is what they need. My suggestion to people who are looking for the best dog food is to research your breed and see what fits for your dog. Do your homework before you commit to a food. This is the only food I will feed my ACD's. We also have a Doberman Pinscher, who has to be on a different food.
customer_reviews.author: lizmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Puppy loves it, but in a side note causes pup to poop 10 times a day. Firm poop, but copious quantity for such a small little thing.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Bodi

customer_reviews.title: Change of ingredient is probably what happened
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been feeding our two Pugs for over 5 years on this. Recently they started smell more than usual, loose stool, and drink too much water. Vet says their health isn’t any way worse than before - no diabetes, no parasites, etc. We tried switching to another brand of equal price range and our pugs’ unusual symptoms went away. No longer smell funky and stopped excessive drinking. My guess is that taste of wild’s raw material changed. Foul smell may have to do with more venison ratio than bison. Excessive water drinking may have to do with salt perhaps. But loose stool is an indication of overall bad food. It’s a shame humans cut corners for little more profit.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Soooo much vomit
customer_reviews.text: I had mixed this with my dog's old food for the past two months and decided that it was time to rip off the bandaid and let her eat just the High Prarie stuff. She had one bowl (1/2 a cup worth) and woke us up vomiting. She kept going back to her water dish and gulping down water just to continue throwing up everything in her stomach. We thought this stuff sounded like a great option given all of the positive reviews, boy were we wrong. Thanks for the 3am rinse-vac session Taste of The Wild. Would love my money back + my missed hours of sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Grain Free Goodbye!
customer_reviews.text: I along with many others believed in the grain free options to be the best money spent for our dogs. After reading the news, and various other publications I was very actively trying to find an alternative as we had no visible effects from the grain free versions of taste of the wild but didn't want to wait to find out. We had been using the grain free taste of the wild for almost 2 years with great success, but once this product arrived it was a no brainer to switch. No real issues switching over that we noticed and we feel much more comfortable long term for the health of our pups with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Truly good, nutritious, fresh & delicious dog food
customer_reviews.text: Fairly priced, awesomely good dog food, well made and fresh.....Listed (Google) one of the 10 top dog foods, 2019, glad its available on Amazon.com and comes so quickly. Only one complaint -- usually my shipment is placed INSIDE my porch, where its safe......however today, although the person who delivered wrote it was on the porch..... it was NOT.....it was left outside, vulnerable to theft. Fortunately, I got home in time to "rescue it" (we've had a spate of 'crimes of opportunity' in my neighborhood, of late.) V much appreciate delivery people putting it inside! Again, wonderful product, and I warmly recommend both vendor and this dog food.
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Talley

customer_reviews.title: My Rottwwieller loves it.
customer_reviews.text: By all accounts this is a great product for your dog. I did google and yahoo searches and as far as I could find there have been no recalls for bad ingredients or other contaminants for this brand. Unlike some other better known brands with multiple recalls on record. As for how to judge the flavor, I guess since he snarfs it up like a hoover it must be good tasting, as I have not personally tried it. He works for food very easily, so I even use(d) 2-3 pieces of kibble as part of his obedience training reward without a complaint from him.
customer_reviews.author: Desert GunR

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but THEN
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got a bad bag. I ordered this food for several months with no issue. Then all 3 of my dogs got so sick. Notified amazon they refunded me my money and sent a new bag (great service) but nope they were throwing up and pooping water. Weaned them off immediately and then no further issues. Sorry taste of the wild. U lasted for a good 5 months
customer_reviews.author: labels&love

customer_reviews.title: My dog has grain alergies and this has worked for 8 years.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 11 has grain allergies that make him scratch. He once scratched his eye so bad he cut the cornea when he was young. We did not know what was causing him to itch. He then had to wear the cone of shame for about 2 years until we found taste of the wild. He loves the pacific salmon. It gives him gas but he loves it. He also eats the high prairie and water fowl. But he really likes the pacific salmon. No more itching since he changed to taste of the wild 8 years ago. The only thing I could ask for is the price to be a bit lower $40 even anyone?
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: My GSP loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Since weaning Sis from the food the breeder was feeding her, this High Prairie Puppy food is the only dry dog food I have fed her. Sis is a black & white German Shorthaired Pointer and as of this post she is 6 month old (Feb 2019). Sis is very healthy and has a nice, healthy coat. Her mostly black head is very smooth and sleek. She loves this food and cleans her bowl every meal. I am very pleased with the results and would readily recommend this dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Alan H. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not for allergy prone dogs
customer_reviews.text: My pups are super sensitive, chihuahua mixes. After switching them to this brand due to cost/reviews one of my dogs developed what looked like an infected/allergy/itchy eyes-just awful looking. I assumed it was the usual due to pollen/Springtime but then due to running out of this dog food, I once more I thought well maybe I should try them on another brand because his symptoms were even worse than normal. Sure enough, this dog food made his allergy aliments the absolute worst...just thought I would share in case your dog is itching relentlessly/suffering from raw eyes. I switched to Purina Sensitive Stomach-Salmon (not a plug) and I have tried everything $$$. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food at a good value! Our dogs won’t eat anything else!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been feeding our 3 Golden Retrievers this brand of food on various flavors for a while now and they just love it! The Amazon subscription service makes it so easy to get it delivered to our door free of charge saving so much time and energy allowing us to avoid the traffic and stores. Great food and great service! Might be tempted to try the new Amazon brand food sometime soon, but for now this one is our steadfast favorite product.
customer_reviews.author: RV/Boat Doctor & Handyman Services

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable grain free high quality protein food!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have been in Taste of the Wild for year now and they absolutely love it. It has eliminated their allergies while providing them good low fat protein. We have tried every flavor and they like them all but love the bison! A great benefit of this brand is the ability to use the puppy food for adult dogs but you do have to adjust for the increased fat. So with 5 dogs at various stages of life, it makes it so much easier to substitute or mix and match when needed. And ironically, my chocolate lab and pit mix both prefer the puppy over the adult for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you enjoy cleaning up puke!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs who have tried countless kinds of food over the years, but I’ve never seen a kibble make them sick like this before. Both of them. It started making them ill (vomit and diarrhea) as soon as we started transitioning them onto the food. I gave them a week to thinking it would get better, but by the end of a week we had to pull the plug completely and dump 20lbs in the garbage. One of our dogs was a rescued street dog and has a stomach made of steel usually, but this food was exploding out of both ends. Back to Blue Buffalo for us.
customer_reviews.author: JZK

customer_reviews.title: Grain free, made in USA and great quality to cost
customer_reviews.text: We've been using taste of the wild for about 3 years now. It's been a brand my dogs seem to love and being grain free and having a variety of flavors to choose from made this brand a no brainer for our fur babies. There are more expensive brands to choose from as well as less expensive, but tatse of the wild at least $50 delivered to my house is the best choice in my opinion. As for the question o was asked for this rrebiew, well I have never taysed it so I am not sure of the flavor, but the fur babies like it allot.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska living

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Won't Eat It.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs won't touch this, like another reviewer. Very strange as I've bought this recipe many times where they liked it. The last time all three (rescues all fully different breeds: pointer, pug and Carin terrier) so I doubt such different dogs would all dislike this recipe. I also wonder if this may be a bad batch--as they did eat this recipe before.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even bother with this brand anymore.
customer_reviews.text: This brand is a great dog food brand however they take advantage wherever they can. Upping the price while lessening the amount of food. Used to buy 40 pound bags for this price, now it’s gone up and there’s only 28 lbs. no deal thanks....
customer_reviews.author: KaReN

customer_reviews.title: Vomiting and breathing problems
customer_reviews.text: So my Pitbull was on Rachel Ray food and I switched to this now my dog has been her 3rd bag of this food and it has been hell. Vomiting and falling over as if she was having a heart attack. Picture those mini goats on you tube when they get scared and fall over . Well that started happening with my dog. She is a very active dog and happy dog I started noticing her behavior becoming very strange and I took her to the vet and they suggested the raw diet . Done with these companies and their harmful dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Corissa

customer_reviews.title: My pups love it
customer_reviews.text: I tried Blue Wilderness and Natural Balance before this, my dogs could never get used to either. I've been feeding my 3 dogs Taste of the Wild for about 5 years now. When there was a recall about 7 months ago I tried to switch to Canadae, after 2.5 months of diarrhea, vomiting, weight gain, and allergies, I gave up and switched back to Taste of the Wild. All problems went away. Also one of my dogs is a very picky eater. This is the ONLY food I've tried that's been a winner all around!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never Again!
customer_reviews.text: Never Again! Long time user! Now getting non regulated crap from China...ancient grains just a selling took...dogs sick, diarrhea nasty!!! As soon as I switched food, they are fine! These guys got too big and instead of holding to quality, they sold out. Do not like they use farm salmon than wild as in their title... Won't use this dig food again, took the advice of others posting on here. What the heck was that jelly crap my dogs kept pooping with this ancient grains?! Nasty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grain free stopped the scratching!
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a skin condition and she would scratch her neck until her skin was raw. It took more than a year of vet visits, skin scraping, and different medications before I found a recommendation for a grain free diet, and this food specifically since her scratching could be due to allergies. After feeding this to my dog, she soon stopped scratching and her skin healed. We have been buying this for several years now and very happy with this food.
customer_reviews.author: sunnyday

customer_reviews.title: FDA Warning!
customer_reviews.text: This brand was mentioned in a recent FDA release suggesting a correlation between grain-free diets and a heart condition called canine dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM). In fact, Taste of the Wild nearly topped the list. Certain breeds are more susceptible to DCM, but evidence suggests that certain grain-free brands even increase DCM rates in dog breeds without a known predisposition to the disease. Best recommendation would be to buy a non-grain-free brand of dog food until these grain-free dog food formulations are more thoroughly tested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THEY CHANGED FORMULA TO SAVE MONEY - I LEFT
customer_reviews.text: Our German Sheppherd had been eating Taste of the Wild since she was a puppy. Over the past six months her frequency and amount of poop has skyrocketed. Also her shedding massively increased vs. anything we have seen previously. Not wanting to assume too much, we switched her to another similar priced dry dog food. Immediately the bulk and frequency of her poop decreased by half. Her coat is slightly better looking. For reference it's been about three weeks since we switched from Taste of the Wild. However it's obvious they've begun adding filler to their product (while charging the same amount!). I'm leaving and never coming back to this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Won’t use again.
customer_reviews.text: I am very concerned because my Veterinarian gave me a list of pet food brands that have been linked to Canine dialated Cardiomypathy and Taste Of The Wild was 3rd on the list with 53 cases reported and diagnosed by a Veterinarian. I have tossed the remainder of this product. I hate to bash any company but this is very disconcerting news.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Colgate- Walcom

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the negative reviews before ordering, I just went based off the star rating. At first I wasn't sure if maybe it was because we were trying a new food, or different treats that I gave her, because it didn't happen everyday. However it is becoming consistent, and she no longer wants to finish her bowl. She's a dog, she lives for food, so it was really sad to see and I feel bad that I let her eat for that long. I don't know if its the brand itself, or like other reviewers said that it seemed different than other purchases since this is the only time I've gotten this brand.
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Tainted
customer_reviews.text: My healthy, strong 5 year old Weimaraner (who has a stomach of steel) has been eating this brand since he was weened. It’s ONLY the ones from Amazon that make him incredibly sick. He has thrown up at least a dozen times since receiving this last bag. This also happened years ago, same scenario. Something’s definitely not right with the ones from Amazon, as they’re either tainted or have gone bad. Buy local and stay away from the ones sold here if you don’t want to end up at the vet.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: New formual gave my dog runny poop
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my dog the old formula for at least five years. Always high quality. I switched him over to this 'New with Ancient Grains" and his poops have been runny ever since. I did a very slow transition from the old to the new and whenever he gets to half of his food being the new formula its always runny poop. I moved him back to the old formula but if I can't get that anymore I'm for sure switching brands. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bradley

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS FOOD.
customer_reviews.text: There is currently a class action lawsuit against the company that puts out this food because they were not forthcoming on the amount of heavy metals and there are over 50 cases that have been found where taste of the wild has caused heart problems in dogs. My dog has joined the list. Please protect your dogs and tell you friends that may buy from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia Del Campo

customer_reviews.title: English Bulldog was Allergic
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 month old English bulldog, and initially when transitioning her to this food slowly she ate it fine. Then when it was time to completely switch she refused the food. She would not eat it at all. Finally by dinner she was starving and forced herself to eat it. She ended up vomiting it all up. The next day was better she ate it for all three meals and didn’t vomit, but the third day vomiting started back up. She also started scratching herself like crazy and whining a lot while doing it. I eventually had to switch her to Purina Pro Plan, and she’s doing great!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: My Finicky Eater Likes This
customer_reviews.text: Having a highly intelligent and trained working dog is a challenge. My dog seems to be the Zagats of dog food...and also human food. We have ordered every dog food imaginable and end up giving many expensive brands away because he would rather starve than touch food that doesn’t please his picky taste palate. He also likes Origen Red and we now mix that in. (If you are thinking of getting a Dutch Shepherd or Belgian Malinois get ready for dogs with picky tastebuds). I can’t speak to the ingredient quality as I have never tasted it myself.. but if he is happy..I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Katein theCity

customer_reviews.title: Product DAMAGED during shipping
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food, its the only one he will eat. I have always had the item delivered inside of a box and never had any issues, however, this time it came in a shipping bag and all the dog food was crushed. I opened the bag and all the kibble is crushed into crumbs and leaking out of the bag. Very dissappointed and will not be ordering again from Amazon if the seller does not replace the damaged food as it leaked out of the bag and it can no longer be fed to my dog. WASTE of money as of right now.
customer_reviews.author: plantefamily

customer_reviews.title: A Top 5 Kibble
customer_reviews.text: I stay up to date on dog food and like to give the best possible at a reasonable rate. I do add some proteins and vegetable just because the dogs really take it down. Taste of the Wild bison (yellow bag) has never had an allergic reaction with dozens of dogs I have cared for and is quite often used as a low value treat when training. I recommend Taste of the Wild to everyone and have yet to get a complaint. While there are a couple better quality kibble the prices are so ridiculous I will not pay almost double for very little (if any) benifit.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: My dog’s favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I ve changed dog foods several times for my two year old. My breeder started feeding her all grain free since she was born. Because my old dog who passed developed wheat allergies as she got older, this time I decided to feed my dog grain free food. I found this product on Chewy.com because of good reviews. When I bought this product for the first time, I even tested which one she would like. She sniffed both old kibbles n this product on my palm n ate only this one! I think dogs search for food for their liking just like we do. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: My shepherd mix Loves it 😍
customer_reviews.text: I got a rescue about 8 months to a year ago and he looked like a dragon with no wings. You could count the ribs his hip bones stuck out his spine was sticking up so far it look like the back of a dragon and he's now 149 pounds. (Gained 50 lbs.) Just turned 2 yrs.old he also had been run over and not Vetted. dragging his left rear leg. He runs like the wind now after good food like this , physical therapy and love. He loves this food.
customer_reviews.author: BelaRosa

customer_reviews.title: Bored dog
customer_reviews.text: Obviously it is very difficult to grade a product like this on quality and taste when I’m not the one eating it. I can say that my nine-month-old Stabyhoun got bored very quickly with this food. After just four months he refuses to eat it and will opt not to eat multiple meals than to eat this. I have been very disappointed given the high ratings online. Changed flavors and he didn’t care for the other flavor either.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it so I love it
customer_reviews.text: Our 85 lb. black lab loves his Taste of The Wild High Prairie food. Despite the fact that he gets the same food twice a day every day, he goes bonkers for every meal. We store the food in a sealed container and it stays fresh until we're ready for a new bag. Wyoming is 7 years old and he is full of energy and doesn't have any issues digesting the food. We are extremely pleased with Taste of The Wild.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag of dog food.
customer_reviews.text: The 1st bag I brought was good so I decided to buy another one but this time there’s mold. My pup has been getting diarrhea and soft stools for a month and I couldn’t find out the problem was until this morning, when I poured food for him and saw almost half of the bag of food was moldy! I tried to return it but it’s too late, if only I have realized it sooner. I will not buy these again, my poor pup has been suffering for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Qhh70

customer_reviews.title: High quality grain free food for puppies
customer_reviews.text: I have a Boston Terrier puppy who was not eating at all the Blue Buffalo chicken puppy kibble. I didn’t wanted to give her chicken nor kibble with grain, so I did some research on peoples experience and reviews and saw that everyone suggested buying Taste of the Wild. OMG is a game changer. She loves this food!!! I use this kibble too as a treat to train her. It is very crunchy, small in size and not hard on her teeth. It has completely stopped the gas/flatulence. I will keep buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: mrs. xmx

customer_reviews.title: Great brand dog food!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got a pet of my own, I did some research on dog foods. I found this brand and it had all the pros I was looking for. My dog (and now a puppy) are happy that every time I order, I have the capability to switch up the flavors. I have always been told my dogs are healthy and everyone asks what brand I feed them. Pricing on Amazon is also cheaper than my local pet store which is always a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Previously I've been feeding my guys a raw diet or expensive premium kibble, but they love this stuff and their coats are super shiney and energy and alertness great. All the dog food reviewers give it top rating. It also is delivered in just a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: D Richman

customer_reviews.title: Dog liked it, but got severe allergies!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a boxer/hound/terrier mix. She really liked eating this food, but over the course of three months, she developed an allergy to it. We got the ancient grains bison flavor. Please watch your dog for redness around the jowls, under the nose, and in between their toes! Also, paw licking, face scratching, etc. Anything that seems excessive compared to your dogs' usual itch level. Our vet even confirmed this food in known to cause allergies over time.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflowers and Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it. I tolerate the price.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon asks about ingredient quality, flavor, and value for money for this item. Value is why it’s 4 stars. Good be a touch cheaper. As far as the rest of this review, my Daschund has no problem with this food and doesn’t eat much anyway. My Poodle devours it like its the greatest thing on the planet. So on behalf of them I’m giving it high marks. I personally can’t vouch for the taste.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Less gas!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I got a French bulldog puppy in November 2017 who had been on royal canin puppy kibble (garbage). He had gas like a farm animal! All the time! Now that I’ve switched him to this quality grain free kibble, he has very little gas!! And, his stools are firmer and well formed. I transitioned him slowly as is recommended and had no trouble getting him to eat it. I even use the kibble as training treats! (And yes in the pic his ears went down. Losing baby teeth I read sometimes causes this due to calcium going to teeth instead of ear cartilage)
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Hank Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Taste of the Wild High Protein Real Meat Recipe Premium Dry Dog Food with Roasted Bison and Roasted Venison is Hank's favorite dog food. Hank is an English Pointer, 8 years old now and healthy as can be. We have fed him this dog food since he was a puppy. He is healthy, active and loves this dog food. Highly recommend this dog food and this Seller. . .have purchased from this Seller several times now.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back as when opened bag, it was not the correct food inside. The pieces of food were so much smaller than the bag we had and the smell was different. Will never buy food online again, we go to pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great product, then this...
customer_reviews.text: We were auto subscribed for a single 28lb bag per month, and they took it upon themselves to send two 14lb bags and charged us the extra $10. I'm happy I found this and also very disappointed. I don't know if this was Amazon or the company that sells it but I am Pi$$ed!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Something Isn’t Right Anymore
customer_reviews.text: Something changed with this dog food. Our dog ate it just fine for a couple years. This spring he started getting really foul smelling loose stools and diarrhea on & off. At first we thought maybe he ate something weird outside on accident. His poo problem has gotten worse, and he now refuses to eat it at all. We cancelled our subscription and will have to switch to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food ...not competitive pricing
customer_reviews.text: I started a subscribe and save with this dog food which was recommended by our breeder....I have no issue with the food itself. It is a quality dog food...my issue was with not having large size when it came time to receive and price hike after 1st 3 months or six months ?....was not a deal so I cancelled.
customer_reviews.author: K. Drake

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My 80lb 16 month old black lab loves this stuff! I originally had him on the Kirkland brand food but he got tired of it and would sometimes skip a meal. With this new food, he can’t WAIT to eat and licks his bowl dry!
customer_reviews.author: dexter p.

customer_reviews.title: Buffalo is the first Ingredient!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVESSSSS this, she has always been one of those dogs that will leave food in her bowl all day until she actually NEEDS to eat, but she eats this up as soon as I put it down for her. I was really impressed with the ingredients too! I used to get anxious about the food I bought for my dog because I couldn’t afford for her to those fancy brands. This is an affordable price and quality ingredients I feel good feeding to my buddy. I got a monthly subscription!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: I'm not an expert
customer_reviews.text: My 50 lb coonhound never ate his (this) food with any enthusiasm, and it's been a lifelong thing (he's 2). He'd ignore it, not finish it. We honestly thought he was just a weird dog, who was otherwise perfectly energetic and healthy. Then I read some very scary articles about grain-free diets for dogs NOT being recommended, with no symptoms until something very bad happens. We have since switched to a Purina brand and he eats like a voracious wildebeast.
customer_reviews.author: A Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Wildly different from bag to bag
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two bags through Amazon and like other reviewers, found quality control to be vastly different from bag to bag. The first bag, my dog could not wait to eat his food and finished every single time. When we reordered, the second bag's worth of food looked completely different and my dog will not touch the stuff. This is a real shame as it is not cheap and we bought a larger bag based on our previous experience.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ahn

customer_reviews.title: Chihuahua loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Best I have tried. Instead of pooping our the fillers, she uses all the nutrients and poops much less. Best part is that she loves all the flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne W.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs’ health has improved with this high quality dog food
customer_reviews.text: We adopted 2 senior Shih Tzus last year. They had health issues and weren’t in great condition. The first thing we did was change their diet to better quality food with less grain, and better protein. I feed them this dry food in the morning with a couple of pumps of salmon oil mixed in. Their coats look better and they have more pep. Great product; highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Micah70

customer_reviews.title: Causes really bad gas!
customer_reviews.text: We have a German Shepherd pup and she seemed to like the flavor of this this food but every time we gave it to her it caused serious gas! The amount of gas was well beyond what a puppy should normally have and it couldn't have been comfortable for our pup. Having a dog with gas all day every day was certainly uncomfortable for the humans in the home. It may not affect your pet this way but for this reason I can't in good conscience recommend this food for anyone's dog. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: You can stop researching dog foods now.
customer_reviews.text: After an exhaustive search and much trial and error, this is the first dog food that all 3 of my dogs can eat happily. We have a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel and 2 Pitbull mixes. We used to use Diamond brand because they had good ingredients but they kept getting recalls for salmonella, so we started the search for a new dog food, and this one has been such a great find. It's expensive, which sucks, but so are vet visits, and my dogs all seem much healthier on this food. We are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: pibblesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My dog says "Buy more."
customer_reviews.text: My flat-coated retriever has been a picky eater at times. Not with this dog food. She is totally focused until it's gone. She likes it well enough to use kibble as training treats. Almost as good as bacon or liver. I can't personally attest to the flavor but I can say Darcy approves. We'll go with the saliva drool test. Highest marks.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food around
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my Boston terrier this brand since she was a puppy (High Prairie puppy formula) and have been using the adult formula for a couple of years now. According to my vet, my dog is very, very healthy, so I'll keep feeding her the Taste of the Wild brand. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Mugsy

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this brand for a couple of years now. The ingredients on packages appears to good quality and pets love it but recently heard there’s elevated levels of lead in the food which is worrisome. Has this company done anything to fix the issue and improve? Are there still high levels of lead in current batches of the food?
customer_reviews.author: N.A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has been eating Taste of the Wild and this particular one for almost a year. There was a sale on another brand that claimed to have the same ingredients and unfortunately it caused an ongoing diarrhea issues for over a week. But the minute we switch back to Taste of the Wild the stool went back to normal within 1-2 days. With that being said. I would never switch again. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ConcernedMom

customer_reviews.title: My GSDs immediately started shedding...and didn't stop
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients are great and the price is better than Merrick, which is what I normally use. I have a black female and a black & tan male and both get occasional brushing. I eased them on to this to try to save $10 per bag, but that was a mistake. I hoped it was just because of the switch, but after 2 bags, the hair is still everywhere. It comes off of them in clumps. I'll be going back to Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McDub

customer_reviews.title: Great value for grain free food...my dog is invigorated!
customer_reviews.text: We made the switch from Purina and were surprised to find this food for the same price! The quality is amazing and our dog's digestion, weight gain and aging issues have been reduced dramatically in just a few weeks! He's looking forward to feeding time now and has a ton more energy. Get this food and literally add years to your dogs life, grain fillers are killing our best friends!
customer_reviews.author: Chena Suggs

customer_reviews.title: Stay with the gain-free version
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this particular version (with "ancient gains") of the Taste of the Wild dog food if your dog even suspected of having allergies to "gains." My vet said gain-free dog food has been linked to heart disease, so I switched and bought the "gain" version for my dog. But within a few days, my dog's skin problem resurfaced. Her skin problem was the reason why she was on the gain-free version at the first place. We are switching back the gain-free salmon version.
customer_reviews.author: Suet Jambard

customer_reviews.title: Finally buffalo for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Have been trying to find a product that has buffalo because my dog loves buffalo. First day she seemed to enjoy it but her second day she has been ignoring her food bowl but the cat has been nibbling on it. I think it is too soon to know if she likes it or not. It is bigger than she usually eats.
customer_reviews.author: A B.

customer_reviews.title: My Senior loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My Border Collie has always been very picky with food so I was nervous to switch him to a senior formula. He loves this food and at almost 13 years old, it works really well for him. He maintains an excellent weight, beautiful coat and no digestive problems at all. Highly recommended, especially for picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia I.

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: With the competition in dog foods it's hard to know what to use. If you are looking for a grain free food, then this is a great value. I have one very picky basset that loves this food. We have two dogs that have been on it for nearly a year and both seem healthier than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Bag
customer_reviews.text: The dog food is great. But the heavy plastic bag containing 28 lbs of dog food was slashed and damaged. The Amazon packaging department, just put some packing tape on the hole, without making an air tight seal. This bag of dog food should not have been sent to me/customer as a new item; it is damaged goods. My Amazon Prime account is no help here.
customer_reviews.author: CLW

customer_reviews.title: Fake version!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this dog food for YEARS and received a bag that was a different shape, different smell and texture. My dog has no interest in the food which is so odd bc she always loves her food. Finally she ate her food only to have diarrhea for 2 days. I took her to the vet who sells this food and she confirmed that it was fake bc Taste of The Wild has not reformulated or changed their recipe since it came out. PLEASE BE AWARE THIS IS AN IMPOSTER AND NOT THE ORIGINAL TATSE OF THE WILD. Purchase from your vet, local dog food store, or Chewy.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Have a picky eater? But this.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old Blue Heeler loves this feed. I used to feed her another grain free product but she seemed to not be about it. Now she loves whenever feedingtime comes around, and she can barely wait. I no longer need to mix other things into her feed because she’ll eat this without egg or wet food mixed into it. Absolutely love this product because it makes my pupper happy!
customer_reviews.author: Martine Grimstad

customer_reviews.title: Just try to find a dry puppy/dog food without chicken, chicken meal, chicken fat,...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! No Chicken anything! My pup seems to have a hard time with chicken, he likes it, but, he licks and scratches a lot after eating it. Good clean ingredients that I am looking for, taste he will eat. I've fed him everyday since receiving and he gladly eats it. Reasonable price for this level of quality and his stool is perfect as well. Thank you :-)
customer_reviews.author: lilsista

customer_reviews.title: grains = flatulence
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been eating taste of the wild for the past 5 years, the ancient grain formulation has given him smelly, offensive, non-stop flatulence. We are at the end of the 28 lbs bag with no reduction in gas. I transitioned from taste of the wild grain-free bison with the new formulation. Just a heads up for those who don't like farts.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Not what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the bag with the Ancient Grains, but received the Grain Free. I was out of dry dog food and didn’t have a choice but to feed it to my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Thompson

customer_reviews.title: My Pug says 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dog food! My pug loves his bison and venison.. and everything really. He's been on this formula since he was a puppy and he has a nice strong body for a pug. I did have to cut back on the recommended amount because he was gaining weight. Right now he weighs 20-23lbs and I give him 1/2cup 2x a day. No house food and the occasional treat. Price for this dog food is excellent in comparison to other brands. Grain free!
customer_reviews.author: Cary G

customer_reviews.title: What a GREAT Dog food!
customer_reviews.text: The ingredients and quality of this brand is essential to my dogs wellbeing. They love the flavor and are healthier for it. The value for the money is a great example of a company that cares about the animals they feed. Thank you very much. Rose Burke
customer_reviews.author: OhNoOne

customer_reviews.title: Both dogs hated it
customer_reviews.text: They just didn't like it. No matter what I added to it, they would eat everything else. Our Cairns Terrier would either just leave it sitting, or sometimes he would tip the bowl over after he ate what ever else was added. Our Rat Terrier would take every kibble out, one by one, leaving a pile next to her bowl. I ended up giving the bag to one of my friends that has a Retriever mix that likes to chew on the families bicycle tires.. Right now, I'm boiling chicken, pork loin, or beef roast with mixed vegetables, then chopping it into bite size pieces, while waiting for the freeze dried food to arrive..
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Dog Food - no red dye
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is pure white. When there is red dye in dog food, it stains the facial fur red, under the eyes and around the mouth. You cannot remove the dye and must wait until new fur grows out before cutting stained fur. This dog food has no red dye. Our dog enjoys the taste and eats all of this dog food when its meal time.
customer_reviews.author: lovebooks

customer_reviews.title: My fur baby loves this product
customer_reviews.text: I started buying this dog food when my fur baby was having stomach issues. He has not had the issues at all since he has been eating this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Garner

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be decent food, but we have to switch
customer_reviews.text: I find it silly to provide feedback on ingredient quality and flavor. I expect it is good. My dog likes it so flavor must be good enough. I am not going to eat or analyze it. That said we need to switch, because our dog grew allergic to Bison with Venison. Off to duck now and hope it sticks longer. This lasted maybe two years.
customer_reviews.author: Just another shopper

customer_reviews.title: MY DOGS LOVE THIS STUFF!!
customer_reviews.text: It said it would be delivered 7-11th of this month but it came literally next day, I'm so impressed. I was running low on dog food and I have two large dogs, one with food insecurity coming from a shelter that I have to contend with. This was great, they both took to it quickly and again, so happy with timely arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TOTW High Protein Dog food.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have eliminated my dogs issue with fecal incontinence, but when he cuts a fart now it will clear the room. He didn't have the gas issue on his old stuff, but fecal incontinence was terrible. He has always been great about asking to go out but with his old food he had problems making it on time.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Haines

customer_reviews.title: I am done with TOTW!
customer_reviews.text: I have used TOTW on the last 4 dogs I have owned and when I adopted my new 4 year old Belgian Malinois I wanted a grain free dog food. We started with the Bison flavor and had great success with it. Her coat got better and her stool was solid. I went with the Ancient Grains thinking this would benefit her diet, I was wrong. Loose stools, itchy skin and she has thrown up multiple times. I would not recommend this product! Plus now TOTW has been linked to heart disease by the FDA. I'm sorry but I am done with TOTW.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Lilly likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My spoiled little Jack Russell/Chihuahua is a picky eater. She seems to like this brand. It seems to agree with her. No issues no troubles switching to this brand. I tasted it myself. Not to bad for dry dog food. (I would never feed my best friend something that I would not eat myself.)
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: No more upset tummy
customer_reviews.text: My dog has ALWAYS had a sensitive stomach and I was always having to change her food every few months, since is started her on this 2 years ago she has DONE GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Hoag

customer_reviews.title: worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: My great dane puppy loves this food. She's a very healthy weight, her coat is silky and shiny. She ran out before her next bag arrived due to an accident that ruined her food and i had to give her a different food for 2 days.... omg is this food worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The puppy likes it
customer_reviews.text: My 10 week Dachshund puppy likes this food. I was giving him the Diamond Naturals brand but TOTW makes him more excited. Also the poop is more solid, darker and less stinky. Cheap foods are made from chicken and the poop smells horrible, this is real beef.
customer_reviews.author: Silvio Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Pups w Allergies beware!
customer_reviews.text: So my dog had started eating this food and we noticed nothing at first. The second day for him eating this my dog broke out in hives and had an extremely swollen face. Now I’m not saying this is a bad food but I do want to give a warning to other pitbull owners, whose babies have allergies. Mine needs grain free, at this point we’re just going to switch to making the food ourselves! swollen vs regular
customer_reviews.author: De'Chanel Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Picky Pug
customer_reviews.text: Okay I must admit I have a very picky pug. However, this food seems to be the only one that the dog find palatable. I have tried all other brands, good brands with high costs, and until now I was begging the booger to eat. If your dog is picky this may do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food
customer_reviews.text: Previously I was feeding my Boxer the Authority brand from PetSmart. When we were looking for a better food, we found taste of the wild and figured we would give it a shot since it's grain free and Boxers are known for having allergy issues. My dog loves the food. His coat looks really good after having eating this the past few months and has had a lot more energy. The only downfall is his breath. It's much smellier than when he was eating the other food, otherwise this has been nothing but great
customer_reviews.author: Scott G

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs went crazy for this dog food. The ingredients are a much better quality that what they were being served. No coaxing or bribing, they just dove in and ate it all in one seating. They are usually such picky eaters. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: D. Gebhart

customer_reviews.title: Makes your puppy into a thief
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves this food so much that we needed to lock up the food. One night she broke in and she ate so much that she looked pregnant. So, I guess that is the ringing endorsement. We have been using Taste of the Wild for our dogs for 10+ years. High quality product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Levy

customer_reviews.title: Premium food
customer_reviews.text: Premium dog food and my dog likes it. It’s stable and doesn’t grow anything while using the bag. I’d like it better if the bag had a seal on it to open and close when used. Most bags have a seal at the top or front.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Picky dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My picky dog loves this food. We switched from another ultra premium dog food that we had to practically force feed. This is really the first time we’ve seen him excited about mealtime and finishing his bowl of food without coercion. Rey happy we made the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Taste of the Wild
customer_reviews.text: I started my dogs out on a small amount mixed with their regular food, which is mostly homemade. They ate it when mixed, but never on its own. However, my dogs are NOT kibble dogs, so hard to tell. I will probably give another flavor a try soon.
customer_reviews.author: echomillcottage

product_meta.title: Taste of the Wild High Protein Real Meat Recipe Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:High Prairie| Size:5lbModern science proves that your puppy shares the DNA of the wolf. Years of domestication and excellent care have turned your puppy from a short-lived potential foe to a long-lived best friend. Although their DNA remains the same and their tastes demand something of the wild, feed your puppy with all the proper ingredients and nutrition they need to thrive.. This grain-free formula provides digestible energy and excellent nutrition for your growing puppy. Made with real roasted meat and a blend of protein sources, this hearty formula offers a taste sensation like no other. Vegetables and fruits deliver antioxidants to help support a healthy lifestyle. Your puppy craves tastes from their wild past. Go ahead and give them one.
feature_bullets: A taste of the wild with ROASTED BISON & VENISON; REAL MEAT is #1 ingredient; optimal amino acid profile & protein rich for LEAN, STRONG MUSCLES
HIGH quality PROTEIN recipe with smaller kibble; tailored for growing puppy; SUPERFOODS for hard-working ANTIOXIDANTS; DHA for BRAIN & VISION

Ingredients From Trusted, Sustainable Sources Around The World; Made With No Grain, Corn, Wheat, Filler; No Artificial Flavors, Colors, Preservatives Added.For adult dogs over 100 pounds, add ½ cup for every 10 additional pounds
High protein ingredients with added vitamins & minerals; Nutrient rich and HIGHLY DIGESTABLE with guaranteed soecies-specific, PROPRIETARY PROBIOTICS
MADE in the USA; FAMILY OWNED & run; food made with scientifically advanced food safety protocols; We'd appreciate your CALL 800.342.4808

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
